ygData.subject: Re: changing KoS
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I am a gnome necromancer. I know it may not be popular but I would rather be a Red Robed necromancer than a Black Robed one.  This was one of my major
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I am a gnome necromancer. I know it may not be popular but I would
rather be a Red Robed necromancer than a Black Robed one. This was one of
my major factors in deciding on the gnome race. (Other than I love to
tinker and such.) One of my life goals is to someday be able to stroll into
all of the "good" cities right past the guards with my head held high. To
this end I already have the Dwarves and Hal flings down to Dubious. I have
yet to start in any major way on the Queynos folks, or the Euridites.

On a separate subject...I am fast approaching level 20. My question is not
which spells to buy, I normally buy them all anyway, but which spells do
folks normally keep memorized when they go into battle? This seems like the
hardest balancing act in the game. With only eight slots and an even sixty
spells to choose from, it's enough to make my little brain literally pop
from indecision. <smile>

Any help would be appreciated.

Signed,
Oserus (gnome necro on Veshaan)
goblin@...

Date: Tue, 22 Jun 1999 09:05:39 -0500 (CDT)
From: Ort-Man <ortman@...>
Subject: Re: changing KoS


You realize that Trolls, Ogres, and DarkElves shouldn't ever kill
Crushbone Orcs. It just a bad thing :)

Zelrek

> I do have to disagree with this. I started out truly KOS with the high
> elves. (Full Scowl ready to Attack.) However, after killing about 380 orcs
> in crush bone (I kept a tally sheet) they now are down to Glares
